qas.question: What static inverter plant lies near New Haven?

context: Near New Haven there is the <a4_0>static inverter plant<a4_0/> of the <a0_0>HVDC Cross Sound Cable<a0_0/>. There are <a1_0><a5_0>three<a5_0/><a1_0/> PureCell Model 400 fuel cells placed in the city of New Haven—one at the New Haven Public Schools and newly constructed Roberto Clemente School, one at the mixed-use 360 State Street building, and one at City Hall. According to Giovanni Zinn of the city's Office of Sustainability, each fuel cell may save the city up to <a2_0><a7_0>$1 million<a2_0/> in energy costs<a7_0/> over a decade. The fuel cells were provided by <a3_0>ClearEdge Power<a3_0/>, formerly <a6_0>UTC Power<a6_0/>.
